intro: Grubovia sedoides, commonly known as the desert orchid, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, succulent-like growth habit and produces striking, showy flowers in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has a deep root system that allows it to survive in harsh, drought-prone environments. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a waxy cuticle to reduce water loss. Grubovia sedoides is often found in rocky outcrops and is adapted to thrive in full sunlight with minimal water.
